conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D, E, or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
The baffles are the blue, orange, and green lines, which separate the different paths of the liquid.
The arrows indicate the direction of the liquid flow, showing liquid flowing out from A, B, and C.
The container shapes (D, E, and F) are marked with arrows pointing to the liquid flowing into them.
The liquid flows out from A.
The liquid flows out from B.
The liquid flows out from C.
The liquid will flow into container D.
The liquid will flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into container F.
